9 Game Changing Tools That Every Remote Developer Can’t Live Without

What we use and why we love it

As remote developers at devAcademy, we are working with customers from around the world, from Los Angeles to Lima. This means that we face special opportunities and challenges when building products for the best tech companies in the world.

We are constantly searching for new productivity and collaboration tools to improve our efficiency and quality of work. Here are the 9 must-have remote work tools that have empowered our company, recommended by our remote developers:

Octocats are adorable.

What is it? A platform for hosting code that uses Git for version control and collaboration.

Why do we ♥ it? GitHub is the largest source-code tool for developers, taking version control, putting it on the cloud, and adding a beautiful user interface on top of it. We love using it because we can create better code as a team — we can see the history of changes, monitor everyone’s code, and ship new features quickly.

That little smiling mountain is adorable, too. c:

What is it? a web based project management software tool to organise tasks, collaborate with clients and get things done.

Why do we ♥ it? The difference between good and bad teams isn’t how much they fail, but how well they can work consistently. Basecamp has helped us allocate our time more efficiently, allowing us to test new ideas and work faster.

#productivity

What is it? A chat-room platform that enables you to send documents and messages without using email, increasing productivity.

Why do we ♥ it? Email is a pain to use. We mean it. Answering emails is seriously unproductive. Slack integrates efficient 3rd party team tools like GitHub, Travis CI, and Google Hangouts. This helps us work within Slack without having to read our emails. Small and large teams can now find and send messages, files, and product updates in an easier way.

You can read more about why we love Slack here:

Time tracking

What is it? Software that tracks employees’ activity levels and time spent on a project.

Why do we ♥ it? Hubstaff helps us measure the time we spend in each task within a project. The results allows us to see where and how we can improve. Another big plus is allowing us to integrate directly into Basecamp, which helps us track how much time we spent on projects.

We also use Skype, sometimes.

What is it? A communication platform that allows anyone to initiate one-on-one or group conversations through text, voice, or video chat.

Why do we ♥ it? Google Hangouts breaks geographical barriers for remote workers. We can communicate with anyone, anywhere, anytime. Google Calendar integration is also really nice.

He runs the builds for us and notifies immediately.

What is it? A continuous integration platform that runs your project’s tests every time you commit to GitHub, and can be configured to push your changes directly to production.

Why do we ♥ it? This tool has saved our lives so many times. Travis CI automatically detects when a commit has been pushed to a GitHub repository, and each time, it will try to build the project and run tests. The best part is that it integrates with Slack, so everyone at devAcademy can review and fix broken code transparently.

What is it? An HTML5 powered tool to design wireframes, mockups, and prototypes.

Why do we ♥ it? We love designing beautiful and simple products and Moqups has contributed to this process. Our team has been able to critique each other’s designs, iterating much faster and more efficiently.

What is it? A web and mobile mockup and UI prototyping tool.

Why do we ♥ it? A good product succeeds when it solves a problem for a user. Our design team uses InVision to offer honest feedback while exploring different prototype solutions. Our favorite part? It synchronizes with Sketch.

What is it? A web-based application where you can create documents that your team can share and edit simultaneously.

Why do we ♥ it? Saving and sharing information has never been easier with Google Docs. One of our company values is transparency. With Google Docs, we’ve been able to collaborate and share information that anyone in our company can see, including our customers, in an easy and transparent way.
